name: Customs & Border Protection
description: Enforcement at US Ports of Entry.
about: CBP protects the public from dangerous people and materials while enhancing the Nation's global economic competitiveness by enabling legitimate trade and travel.

canDo.title: Search Without Warrant
canDo.detail: At ports of entry, CBP has broad authority to search persons, baggage, and merchandise without a warrant or probable cause.

canDo.title: Inspect Electronics
canDo.detail: Officers can request you to unlock devices for manual inspection. A forensic search (downloading data) generally requires reasonable suspicion.

cannotDo.title: Deny Entry to Citizens
cannotDo.detail: CBP cannot deny entry to U.S. citizens. They may delay you for verification, but you have an absolute right to return home.
cannotDo.legalBasis: Kent v. Dulles; U.S. v. Arnold

cannotDo.title: Discriminate
cannotDo.detail: Officers cannot select you for personal searches or secondary inspection based solely on your religion, race, national origin, gender, or ethnicity.

rights.title: Right to Silence
rights.detail: You have the right to remain silent. However, you must answer questions regarding your citizenship and customs declarations. Refusing other questions may cause delay.

rights.title: Attorney Access
rights.detail: Generally, you do not have a right to a lawyer during primary or secondary inspection at the border, unlike in police custody.

quickPhrases.phrase: I do not consent to a search of my device. Am I legally required to unlock it?
Am I being detained for a criminal matter, or is this a routine immigration inspection?
quickPhrases.explanation: Clarifies the nature of the stop.

name: Transportation Security Admin
about: TSA protects the nation's transportation systems to ensure freedom of movement for people and commerce.

canDo.title: Screen Everyone
canDo.detail: TSA is authorized to screen all passengers and property. If you refuse screening, you will be denied entry to the secure area and cannot fly.

cannotDo.title: Strip Search
cannotDo.detail: TSA officers are NOT law enforcement and are not authorized to conduct strip searches. If they suspect you are concealing something, they must call police.

rights.title: Opt-Out of Scanner
rights.detail: You have the right to opt out of the AIT (body scanner) and request a manual pat-down instead. You can also request this be done in private.

quickPhrases.phrase: I opt out of the scanner. I request a manual pat-down.
quickPhrases.explanation: Standard phrase to initiate alternative screening.

name: Immigration & Customs Enforcement
about: ICE enforces federal laws governing border control, customs, trade and immigration to promote homeland security and public safety.

canDo.title: Question Status
canDo.detail: ICE agents can ask questions about your immigration status and request proof of lawful presence.

canDo.title: Detain for Removal
canDo.detail: If they have probable cause to believe you are in the U.S. unlawfully, they can detain you for removal proceedings.

cannotDo.title: Enter Private Areas
cannotDo.detail: ICE cannot enter private areas (like a home or private office) without a judicial warrant signed by a judge, or your consent.

rights.title: Right to Silence
rights.detail: You have the right to remain silent. You do not have to answer questions about where you were born or how you entered the U.S. (Unless at the border/customs control itself).

rights.title: Request Lawyer
rights.detail: In administrative immigration proceedings, you have the right to a lawyer, but the government is not required to provide one for free.

quickPhrases.explanation: Determines if you are being detained or if the encounter is consensual.

quickPhrases.phrase: I choose to remain silent and I want to speak to a lawyer.

name: Homeland Security Investigations
about: HSI is the principal investigative arm of DHS, responsible for investigating transnational crime and threats.

canDo.title: Criminal Investigation
canDo.detail: HSI agents investigate criminal activities like human trafficking, drug smuggling, and financial crimes. They have broad law enforcement powers.

cannotDo.title: Coerce Confessions
cannotDo.detail: Like all law enforcement, HSI cannot force you to incriminate yourself or deny you legal counsel during a custodial interrogation.

rights.title: Right to Attorney
rights.detail: If HSI is questioning you for a criminal matter, you have the full right to an attorney, including a public defender if you cannot afford one.

quickPhrases.phrase: I do not wish to answer any questions without an attorney present.

name: Massachusetts State Police
about: The principal statewide law enforcement agency in the Commonwealth of Massachusetts.

canDo.title: Demand License
canDo.detail: Failure to produce license and registration upon request is a civil infraction or arrestable offense in MA.

canDo.title: Order Exit
canDo.summary: Can order you out of car.
canDo.detail: Police can order a driver to exit the vehicle if they have a reasonable belief of a safety threat. You should comply physically but remain silent.

cannotDo.title: Search Without Cause
cannotDo.detail: Police cannot search your trunk or vehicle interior without probable cause, your consent, or a warrant.

rights.title: Right to Record
rights.detail: You have a First Amendment right to openly record police officers performing duties in public spaces in MA.

quickPhrases.phrase: I do not consent to any searches.
quickPhrases.explanation: Clearly establishes lack of consent for legal record.

quickPhrases.phrase: Am I being detained or am I free to go?
quickPhrases.explanation: Clarifies legal status of the stop.
